# Tools and Examples

These notebooks use:

* [pystac](https://pystac.readthedocs.io/): PySTAC is a library for working with SpatioTemporal Asset Catalogs (STAC) in Python 3.
* [rioxarray](https://corteva.github.io/rioxarray/stable/): rasterio xarray extension
* [sat-search](https://github.com/sat-utils/sat-search): Sat-search is a Python 3 library and a command line tool for discovering and downloading publicly available satellite imagery using STAC compliant API.
* [stackstac](https://stackstac.readthedocs.io/): stackstac.stack turns a STAC collection into a lazy xarray.DataArray, backed by dask.

## Notebooks

* list-collections.ipynb shows how to use pystac to list all the collections in the VEDA API.
* no2-timeseries.ipynb shows how to use stackstac, satsearch and rioxarray to create a timeseries.

Run the notebooks with [![Binder](https://mybinder.org/badge_logo.svg)](https://mybinder.org/v2/gh/nasa-impact/veda-documentation/HEAD)
